channel.title: Jesus
channel.description: Can someone give me how they thought there was a god? If there is a god, who created him... I just do not understand. A god just cant appear from who the fuck knows where, then create living creatures. Thats just my opinion. Tell me yours. :confused:

item.title: Jesus
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

I support if people want to be religious. I am not.

But a large argument that religious fundamentalists use is something along the lines of, “How could something just exist. When you break it down, something must have made the first atoms.”

I only mention this because it is extremely hypocritical, and I hope it will not be brought into this argument.

Ask the same person who made God, the response is, “He was always there.”

Read full topic

item.title: Jesus
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Payback Is A Bitch:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNocC85MU6w&feature=related

Video is pure bullshit.

  1. It didn’t come out of nothing. You can’t ask how it got there, because I can easily ask “How did “God” get there?” in which case you would reply, “He was always there,” and I could easily say, “likewise.”

  2. I do not say that the universe is “perfect” for human life. Our Earth is, most definitely habitable, but then why isn’t Mars, or Jupiter, or Mercury habitable. Wouldn’t “God” make the best for his “children.” Also, inference != fact, and I do most certainly believe that the universe has to come to be what it is today because of random events. Mathematics, logic, and science are all products of the human mind, and they are that perfect because we made them to suit our needs, regardless of how mindless or accidental we are, the product of our minds is perfect enough for us.

  3. Morals are taught to us by society, which is also what we made ourselves for our cadence and order in our society. They are taught to us to be second-nature so that our society can be relatively orderly. “It is wrong to murder…” (the example given) is literally us being taught second-nature not to murder, so that society will function. If “God” wanted to instill these “morals” into us, then why didn’t he, and instead make murderers and rapists in the streets. Don’t say “free will,” because these “morals” should apparently be, as the video said, “instinctual”. The murderers/rapists/etc. were either not taught those, or have a skewed perspective (a.k.a. conscious, a.k.a not instinctive) therefore “God” could not have instilled them into us.

  4. See #2.

  5. Was too busy laughing my ass off to watch the rest, so… yeah…

Also, one more question for you: If “God” is omnipotent, what is the point of sex when he can just “zap” the baby into the womb as he [supposedly] did with Jesus. If I recall correctly, the Christian church prohibits sex other than for procreation, so why not eliminate it completely by just “God” making the woman pregnant after she and her partner get married.

Read full topic

item.title: Jesus
item.dc:creator: @ilyaostr9 io9
item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

[quote=“Payback Is A Bitch, post:367, topic:190493”][quote author=io9 link=topic=253962.msg2502012#msg2502012 date=1224722457]
I’m surprised nobody has yet mentioned Epicurus’ problem of evil.
[/quote]
the philosophy of religion and theology, the problem of evil is the problem of reconciling the existence of evil or suffering in the world with the existence of God.[1] The problem is most often discussed in the context of the personal god of the Abrahamic religions, but is also relevant to polytheistic traditions involving many gods.
-Wikipedia
Ya, well God gave humans freewill, we cause suffering on our own.[/quote]
How do you explain diseases? I doubt idiots who followed a book their entire life can create nonhuman (a.k.a. virii, hostile bacteria,e tc.) life.
What about natural disasters? I doubt humans can create hurricanes and tornadoes (and please don’t say, “we caused global warming… etc” because those [natural disasters] existed way before the combustion engine)

As stated by Epicurus himself. “If God is potent enough and willing enough to eradicate evil, then why not do it? If he is potent enoguh but not willing to, is he not evil himself? And if he is not potent enough to do so, is he not a god?”

Read full topic

Fkn retards.

item.title: Jesus
item.dc:creator: @Payback_Is_A_Bitch Payback Is A Bitch
item.description:
@Payback_Is_A_Bitch wrote:

[quote=“magma, post:1, topic:238319”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=253962.msg2500085#msg2500085 date=1224617835]

There is no way either to prove or disprove a god. So, considering that… There is no real way of knowing. Just look around you every once in a while. Its perfect… and we will also know in the end what is true and what isn’t.

Stop forcing this discussion around in circles. We’re perfect because of evolution, and if you refuse to bother understanding it then that’s your fault and you shouldn’t be telling us that there is a god.

If you actually knew anything more about evolution than ‘we evolved from monkeys and birds evolved from cats’ then you could put forward a few decent points countering this theory - otherwise it’s not going to make fucking sense is it, a cat turning into a bird over 4000 years?

When you people say to us that you’re not a monkey and it’s not logical that a rabbit can be a randomly mutated lizard, it just shows us your own ignorance. Not that your a christian, it just shows that you haven’t thought outside the box when at primary school you were spoonfed this theory.

Actually I know more than that you idiot. I have to watch sessions of this shit… Debates and everything how about y’all learn about the science leaning towards a god? Instead of assuming there isn’t one. http://freehovind.com/watch-4308235066145651150 <- watch that 2 hour long video. Make me a list of the points he says and what you have to say about it. Unless you disprove every point he says in all 7 of his seminars, with physical evidence. Then I will keep believing in a God. And we both know your not going to do that, and if you do your gonna be bullshitting everything. Because its harder to disprove something that’s real then it is to that something that is not.
[/quote]
Which brings us all back to the fundamental point: If there was an ancient book from 2000 years ago describing an omnipotent, omnipresent, invisible flying spaghetti monster ruling the world would you believe it? If you believe in a god then I’m sure you’d believe in the flying spaghetti monster if things were different.[/quote]
No, Believing in a God Isn’t illogical. If you really ponder on the earth… Dude I have no fucking doubt in mind their was a designer. I don’t believe it just got like this over time of evolving, Period.

Read full topic

item.title: Jesus
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Just think about god for a second. Some magical higher power right? Why should we assume he exists by default. Until it is proven that god exists I will not believe in him. Not the other way around, otherwise we might as well believe in the flying spaghetti monster as there is no proof he does not exist.

And lmao @ kent hovind (assuming who that is by the link). Biggest idiot ever, we debunked most of that shit at school. Oh by the way, he’s also in prison for 10 years. Not a very trust worthy source?

Kent Hovind had been charged with falsely declaring bankruptcy, making threats against federal officials, filing false complaints, failing to get necessary building permits, felony assault and battery (charges later dropped),[115] and various tax-related charges. He was convicted of federal tax offenses and related charges, for which he is currently serving a 10-year sentence.

I’ll stick to the facts, not some fundamentalist christian nut job.

Read full topic

item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

[quote=“JukuG, post:358, topic:190493”][quote author=Payback Is A Bitch link=topic=253962.msg2499107#msg2499107 date=1224551408]

lol, it’s fun to read how truly stupid the idiots are on this forum. Plus, it’s even funner to read replies from idiots who think they are very clever with words, lol.

Oh and a topic like this should be in the spam section since if God truly is omnipotent, divine, etc… then it is impossible to unravel a tough sided being like that. Just my 2 cents.
[/quote][quote]I am convinced that neither Death nor Life, neither angels nor demons, neither present nor the future, nor any powers, neither height nor depth nor anything else in all creation, will be able to separate us from the love of that is in God Christ Jesus our Lord.[/quote]

My bad, but I completely missed your point with posting that quote, mind giving a brief explanation?[/quote]He obviously didn’t understand what the hell you were saying, because his post had no point at all.

item.title: Jesus
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

Payback Is A Bitch:

Carbon-14 Dating is so inaccurate, there was a mammoth found, use carbon 14 on skin and bones and they were billions of years appart

lets suppose for a moment that what you said is plausible (it isnt)

how do you explain radioactivity?
you have a rock of metal with some uranium and lead, as time goes on, we see the uranium turn into lead.
logically, the lead is only there because uranium changed into it, there must have been a time when the lump of metal was 100% uranium.
we know the rate uranium changes into lead, if we count back to the time when it was 100% uranium, we can see the rock is around 3.5 billion years old.
therefore the earth is at least that old. (the currently accepted age is 4.55 billion)

explain that creationist!

Read full topic

item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Source please.

[quote=“Payback Is A Bitch, post:347, topic:190493”][quote author=yakman link=topic=253962.msg2496328#msg2496328 date=1224422549]

Dude, Everything evolves. But I don’t believe in that type of evolving (Human race). There is about 4000 years on record… But yet… we haven’t seen the slightest bit of evolution for the human race. And its not like the finch turned into a dog… (Evolution of human we came from monkeys and what not)

epic stupidity and arrogance,
you think you’re somehow special because you’re human and that you’re exempt from evolution

also evolution takes much longer then 4000 years
[/quote]
Kinda funny only 4000 years on record and according to the bible thats when the flood destroyed all… Seems alot like your just ignorant.[/quote]
